A meeting of the entire Senior
Class will be held on Wednesday, November 14 in Latrobe 120 at 12.30,
it has been announced. It is urgent
that every member of the class attend. A new constitution for the class
will be presented for approval and
adoption. There will also be a discussion of class dues and plans for
June week.

Collection of Carl Schurz Memorial
Foundation Includes Art,
Literature, and Music

German Works On
Exhibit In Library

Interracial Commission
Hears Talk On Naziism

An exhibit of German works which
have been secured by the library will
be shown in the main reading room
in the early part of the week. The
collection has been promoted by the
Can Schurz Memorial Foundation,
and it includes almost two hundred
volumes.
The exhibit will contain books of
the modern type of German literature of art, travel and music. It will
remain at the University for about
two weeks. Many large colleges
in
the East have had the collection on
exhibition.

Business Staff To Meet
A meeting of the business staff of
the Hullabaloo will be held on Wednesday in the office in Levering Hall.
All candidates and present members
must report at 12:30.

Nominations for officers of the
freshman class will take place in
the assembly room of Latrobe
Hall tomorrow at 12:20, instead
of on Thursday, so as not to interfere with the junior class meeting scheduled for that hour. On
Friday, nominations will be reopened, and the election will be
held.
Only those members of the
freshman class who have paid
their class dues are eligible to
hold office or to vote. The election is being conducted by the
Student Council.

Prominent men connected with the
Young Men's Christian Association
throughout the United States, will attend the celebration of the fiftieth
anniversary of the founding of the
Johns Hopkins chapter of the Y. M.
C. A., November 20-28. The opening
meeting will be a faculty reception
and luncheon for Dr. Lynn Harold
Hough.

The most important meeting of the
series will be held November 25. This
day is the anniversary of the actual
founding of the Hopkins group.
The meeting will be held in Levering
Hall and will be under the auspices
of the Council of Christian Associations of Maryland, Delaware, and the
District of Columbia.
The principal

will be Rev.

Activity" will be the topic of the first
A. R. L. Dohme Chemical Lecture, to
be delivered by Dr. Phoebus Aaron
Levene, Friday at 4 p. m. in Remsen 101.
Dr. Levene took his degree at the
Imperial Military Medical Academy
of St. Petersburg, Russia, in 1891,
and has since studied at the Universities of Berne, Marburg, Berlin, Munich, and Columbia. He is a member of eight American and six foreign scientific societies, was awarded
the Willard Gibbs medal in 1931, and
is the author of numerous papers on
organic chemistry. He is now at the
Rockefeller Institute.

and dropkicked a field goal to boost
the lead to 10-0. This boot is believed to be the longest three-pointer

another sustained drive.

An exhibit of German works which
have been secured by the library will
be shown in the main reading room
in the early part of the week. The
collection has been promoted by the
Can Schurz Memorial Foundation,
and it includes almost two hundred
volumes.
The exhibit will contain books of
the modern type of German literature of art, travel and music. It will
remain at the University for about
two weeks. Many large colleges
in
the East have had the collection on
exhibition.

A meeting of the business staff of

freshman class will take place in
the assembly room of Latrobe
Hall tomorrow at 12:20, instead

held.

freshman class who have paid
their class dues are eligible to
hold office or to vote. The election is being conducted by the

territory. Stopped temporarily, Reynolds dropped back to the 32-yard line
and dropkicked a field goal to boost
the lead to 10-0. This boot is believed to be the longest three-pointer
made this fall.
McClean took a hand in the scoring
after the intermission when he went
over on an end run which climaxed
another sustained drive.
